Line 256: Line 256:
On television, Radar's character started off worldly and sneaky, a clerk who carried with him at all times a pocketful of passes for any potential scam that might arise. At one point, he tried to mail home a [[Jeep]], [[Salami slicing|piece by piece]]. (Hawkeye commented that once Radar's mailman found out, he'd have a retroactive [[hernia]].) He was known for his tremendous appetite for heaping portions of food. He was also not averse to drinking Col. Blake's brandy and smoking his cigars when the colonel was off-duty, and he occasionally drank the [[moonshine]] liquor that Hawkeye and McIntyre made in their [[Pot still|still]].
On television, Radar's character started off worldly and sneaky, a clerk who carried with him at all times a pocketful of passes for any potential scam that might arise. At one point, he tried to mail home a [[Jeep]], [[Salami slicing|piece by piece]]. (Hawkeye commented that once Radar's mailman found out, he'd have a retroactive [[hernia]].) He was known for his tremendous appetite for heaping portions of food. He was also not averse to drinking Col. Blake's brandy and smoking his cigars when the colonel was off-duty, and he occasionally drank the [[moonshine]] liquor that Hawkeye and McIntyre made in their [[Pot still|still]].
â
As the series progresses, this worldly version of Radar was apparently not wholly to the writers' liking, and Radar evolved into a wimpy naÃ¯ve farm boy. Cigars and strong liquor made him ill or dizzy (despite him frequently drinking and smoking cigars previously), and despite numerous references to him losing his [[virginity]] in earlier episodes, he appeared to have regained it later in the series. His favorite beverage was [[Nehi]] Brand Grape Soda. In "[[The Novocaine Mutiny]]," it is revealed that Radar won $300 from Sgt. Zale in a poker game. A minor change was that he lost the ability to speak fluent Korean which should have been a blow to the camp as he was the only person who spoke it, even if in later episodes it was only a few halting sentences.
+
As the series progresses, this worldly version of Radar was apparently not wholly to the writers' liking, and Radar evolved into a naÃ¯ve farm boy. Cigars and strong liquor made him ill or dizzy (despite him frequently drinking and smoking cigars previously), and despite numerous references to him losing his [[virginity]] in earlier episodes, he appeared to have regained it later in the series. His favorite beverage was [[Nehi]] Brand Grape Soda. In "[[The Novocaine Mutiny]]," it is revealed that Radar won $300 from Sgt. Zale in a poker game. A minor change was that he lost the ability to speak fluent Korean which should have been a blow to the camp as he was the only person who spoke it, even if in later episodes it was only a few halting sentences.
The first cast member of ''M*A*S*H'' to be hired, Gary Burghoff was the fourth and last to leave, following the departures of [[McLean Stevenson]] and [[Wayne Rogers]] in 1975, and [[Larry Linville]] in 1977.
The first cast member of ''M*A*S*H'' to be hired, Gary Burghoff was the fourth and last to leave, following the departures of [[McLean Stevenson]] and [[Wayne Rogers]] in 1975, and [[Larry Linville]] in 1977.
